required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PRF Pulpotomy Using Different Bioceramic Materials in Permanent Molars
clinical_study.official_title: Outcome of PRF Pulpotomy Using Different Bioceramic Materials in Permanent Molars With Irreversible Pulpitis: A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: this study aimed to compare the clinical and radiographic outcomes of full pulpotmy after application of Biodentine, or MTA, or Portland cement above PRF membrane In permanent molars with irreversible pulpitis

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: permanent molar with symptomatic irreversible pulpitis

primary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours, 48 hours, 1 week, every 3 months for 12 months
primary_outcome.description: persistence , relief , or exacerbation of pain using visual analogue scale for pain score

primary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours, 48 hours, 1 week, every 3 months for 12 months
primary_outcome.description: appearance of periapical swelling or facial swelling after the clinical procedures (Binary outcome: Yes/No)

primary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours, 48 hours, 1 week, every 3 months for 12 months
primary_outcome.description: appearance of teeth mobility after the clinical procedures (record of periodontal pocket depth)

secondary_outcome.description: measure of the calcific bridge thickness using CBCT

arm_group.description: pulpotomy with PRF and white Portland cement
pulpotomy with PRF and Mineral trioxide aggregate

intervention.description: pulpotomy with PRF and white Portland cement
pulpotomy with PRF and white Mineral trioxide aggregate

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- spontaneous, lingering pain exacerbated by hot and cold , and/or radiating pain
- Responded to cold and electric pulp testing
Exclusion Criteria:
- pain on palpation, percussion,
- mobility or swelling
- peridontall widening
- Teeth with marginal periodontitis or crestal bone loss
- resorption
- calcified canals

reference.citation: Asgary S, Eghbal MJ. Treatment outcomes of pulpotomy in permanent molars with irreversible pulpitis using biomaterials: a multi-center randomized controlled trial. Acta Odontol Scand. 2013 Jan;71(1):130-6. doi: 10.3109/00016357.2011.654251. Epub 2012 Feb 20.

Cushley S, Duncan HF, Lappin MJ, Tomson PL, Lundy FT, Cooper P, Clarke M, El Karim IA. Pulpotomy for mature carious teeth with symptoms of irreversible pulpitis: A systematic review. J Dent. 2019 Sep;88:103158. doi: 10.1016/j.jdent.2019.06.005. Epub 2019 Jun 20.
